mapper.sql: SELECT up.id, up.name, up.introduce, up.telephone, up.mobilephone, up.create_date as createDate, up.update_date as updateDate, up.email, up.birthday, up.gender, up.starff_id as starffId, up.position, up.type, ua.id as "account.id", ua.create_time as "account.createTime", ua.password as "account.password", ua.salt as "account.salt", ua.status as "account.status", ua.account as "account.account", ua.email as "account.email", ua.mobilephone as "account.mobilephone", r.id as "account.role.id", r.name as "account.role.name", r.description as "account.role.description", org.id as "org.id", org.name as "org.name", org.description as "org.description", org.weight as "org.weight", org.pid as "org.pid" FROM manage_user_profile up join manage_user_account ua on up.id = ua.id left join manage_role r on r.id = ua.role_id left join manage_organization org on up.org_id = org.id
mapper.insert: insert into manage_user_profile( id, name, introduce, telephone, mobilephone, create_date, update_date, email, birthday, gender, starff_id, position, type, org_id ) values( #{id}, #{name}, #{introduce}, #{telephone}, #{mobilephone}, #{createDate}, #{updateDate}, #{email}, #{birthday}, #{gender}, #{starffId}, #{position}, #{type}, #{org.id} )
mapper.update: UPDATE manage_user_profile SET name = #{name}, introduce = #{introduce}, telephone = #{telephone}, mobilephone = #{mobilephone}, update_date = #{updateDate}, email = #{email}, birthday = #{birthday}, gender = #{gender}, starff_id = #{starffId}, position = #{position}, org_id = #{org.id} WHERE id = #{id}
